response_text:
{
  "conversation": [
    {
      "turn_id": 1,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:30",
      "text": "Hi, I’m one of the emergency room doctors. I know you just came over from dialysis. Can you tell me in your own words what brought you in today?",
      "evidence_eids": ["ADM#000001", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 2,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:29",
      "text": "My right side of my head has been killing me. It’s that same shingles area around my right eye and forehead. It’s been worse the last few days, and today at dialysis I felt dizzy and lightheaded. My vision’s been blurry too.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 3,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:27",
      "text": "Okay. You’ve had shingles involving that right eye before, with nerve pain there for a long time, right?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000003", "DX#000007", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 4,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:26",
      "text": "Yeah, years now. They told me it was shingles in the eye. I’ve had this burning, stabbing pain on the right forehead and around the eye ever since.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000003", "DX#000007", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 5,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:25",
      "text": "Have you changed any of your pain medicines recently? I see you were on gabapentin before.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 6,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:24",
      "text": "I was taking 100 milligrams of gabapentin, but the pain got worse so I bumped it up myself to 300 once a day over the last few weeks. Then I started feeling really off balance and lightheaded, and my son read the side effects and told me to stop it a day or two ago.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 7,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:22",
      "text": "Got it. Any fevers, chills, neck stiffness, or sensitivity to light or sound?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 8,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:21",
      "text": "No fevers or chills. My neck feels okay. Light and sound don’t really bother me. It’s just this constant pain and itching on my face and scalp and the dizziness.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 9,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:19",
      "text": "You’re on dialysis for kidney failure from HIV, correct? When was your last dialysis and how much fluid did they take off today?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000001", "DX#000002", "DX#000005", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 10,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:18",
      "text": "Yes, I don’t make urine. I go three times a week. I was there today and they took off about 1.2 liters, they said.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 11,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:16",
      "text": "You also have HIV/AIDS and haven’t been on HIV medications for a while, right?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000001", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 12,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:15",
      "text": "Yeah, I’ve been off the HIV meds. I had trouble sticking with them and they made me feel sick. I know my CD4 was really low last time.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "LAB#000045"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 13,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:13",
      "text": "We’ll recheck your CD4 count today. Right now your blood pressure is on the low side, 86 over 54, and your heart rate is in the 90s. We’re going to get some blood work, a CT scan of your head, and a chest X‑ray, and start some IV fluids. We’ll also look carefully at your eye and skin.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "RAD#000001", "RAD#000002", "LAB#000002", "LAB#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 14,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:12",
      "text": "Okay. I’m just worried it might be something in my brain or my eye again.",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 15,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:10",
      "text": "That’s exactly why we’re doing the head CT and eye exam. If we’re worried about infection around the brain, we might talk about a spinal tap, but we’ll see what the first tests show.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "RAD#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 16,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H-02:05",
      "text": "I’m going to start an IV and draw some blood now. You may feel a quick pinch. We’ll also put some dye in your eye to look for any shingles‑related damage.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 17,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:04",
      "text": "Alright, just tell me before you do anything near my eye. It’s really sensitive.",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 18,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:50",
      "text": "We’ve done the fluorescein exam of your right eye. We don’t see any of the classic shingles‑type scratches on the cornea. Your right eye is red, and you have those red plaques and small ulcers on the right side of your face and forehead, but nothing that looks like a new eye ulcer.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 19,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:49",
      "text": "So my eye itself looks okay?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 20,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:48",
      "text": "So far, yes. We’ll still have the eye specialists see you once you’re upstairs, given your history of shingles in that eye.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 21,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:40",
      "text": "Your first labs are back. Your white blood cell count is low at 2.4, and you have some eosinophils. Your creatinine is 5.8, which fits with your kidney failure. We also checked a blood gas that shows a normal pH and a lactate of 2.2, which is only mildly elevated.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "LAB#000042", "LAB#000017", "LAB#000043"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 22,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:39",
      "text": "Is that why I feel so tired all the time, the low white count?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 23,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:38",
      "text": "The low white count is more about your immune system being weak from HIV. It doesn’t usually cause fatigue by itself, but it does mean you’re at higher risk for infections.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000042", "LAB#000052", "LAB#000045", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 24,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:30",
      "text": "We’re going to give you some IV fluids now because your blood pressure is still low. We’ll also start antibiotics—vancomycin and cefepime—to cover for possible line or other infections, and acyclovir to cover for possible shingles reactivation while we sort this out.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "PHARM#000008", "PHARM#000011", "PHARM#000013", "RX#000008", "RX#000011", "RX#000013", "RX#000020"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 25,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:29",
      "text": "I’m okay with that. I just don’t want to end up on a breathing machine or anything.",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 26,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:28",
      "text": "Right now you’re breathing fine on your own and your oxygen level is good. The fluids and medicines are to keep things from getting worse.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "RAD#000002"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 27,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:15",
      "text": "Your head CT is back. It doesn’t show any bleeding, stroke, or mass. It does show some heavy calcifications along the coverings of the brain, which we see in people with long‑standing kidney failure like you, but nothing acute.",
      "evidence_eids": ["RAD#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 28,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:14",
      "text": "So there’s nothing new wrong in my brain?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 29,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:13",
      "text": "Correct—no new stroke or bleeding on the scan. If we were very worried about infection around the brain, the next step would be a spinal tap, but that’s something we’d only do if absolutely necessary.",
      "evidence_eids": ["RAD#000001", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 30,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:05",
      "text": "Your chest X‑ray also looks clear—no pneumonia, no fluid in the lungs. We can see your dialysis catheter coming up from below into the right atrium, and it’s in good position.",
      "evidence_eids": ["RAD#000002"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 31,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-01:04",
      "text": "That’s good. My chest feels okay, just that weird feeling earlier.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 32,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-00:55",
      "text": "While we were giving you fluids, your heart rhythm changed briefly to atrial fibrillation—an irregular rhythm—with your heart rate around 117. You said you felt a funny feeling in your chest. It’s back to normal now, but we’re going to keep you on the monitor.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000006", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 33,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-00:54",
      "text": "Yeah, it felt strange for a minute, but it went away. I’ve had that before when I was really sick.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000006", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 34,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-00:50",
      "text": "We also checked your heart enzymes. Your troponin is a bit elevated, but your CK and CK‑MB are in the normal range. Given your kidney disease, a mild bump in troponin can happen without a heart attack, but we’ll keep an eye on it.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000015", "LAB#000016", "LAB#000023", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 35,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H-00:40",
      "text": "Given your low blood pressure, the brief atrial fibrillation, and your weak immune system, we’re going to admit you to the intensive care unit for close monitoring. We’ll continue fluids and antibiotics and watch your blood pressure and heart rhythm closely.",
      "evidence_eids": ["ICU#000001", "DS#000001", "PHARM#000008", "PHARM#000013"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 36,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-00:39",
      "text": "Do I really need the ICU? I feel a little better after the fluids.",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 37,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H-00:38",
      "text": "You’ve needed about 3 liters of fluid to get your blood pressure up from the 70s to the 90s, and with your HIV and dialysis, we’d rather be cautious. Once things are clearly stable, we can move you to the regular floor.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "ICU#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 38,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+00:05",
      "text": "We’re in the MICU now. Your blood pressure is around 100 over 60, heart rate in the 90s, and you’re on room air. I’m going to hook you up to the monitors and give you your usual medicines like aspirin, cinacalcet, and sevelamer, plus pain medicine if you need it.",
      "evidence_eids": ["ICU#000001", "RX#000001", "RX#000002", "RX#000003", "RX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 39,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:06",
      "text": "My head still hurts a lot. Can I get something stronger than Tylenol?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 40,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+00:07",
      "text": "You have an order for oxycodone by mouth. I’ll bring that now and we’ll see if it helps your headache and facial pain.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000004", "RX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 41,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+12:30",
      "text": "Good morning. I’m the ICU attending. Overnight your blood pressure has stayed in the low 90s to 100s after the fluids, and your heart rhythm is back in normal sinus rhythm. Your labs this morning show your hemoglobin is 12.6, platelets are low at 101, and your white count is still low at 2.5. Your CD4 count is 6, which is extremely low.",
      "evidence_eids": ["ICU#000001", "LAB#000004", "LAB#000008", "LAB#000042", "LAB#000045", "LAB#000052", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 42,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:31",
      "text": "Six? That sounds really bad. What does that mean for me?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 43,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+12:33",
      "text": "A CD4 of 6 means your immune system is very weak and you’re at high risk for serious infections. We strongly recommend restarting HIV medications as an outpatient with your HIV doctor. In the meantime, we’re going to restart preventive antibiotics—Bactrim three times a week and azithromycin once a week—to help prevent certain infections.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000045", "LAB#000048", "LAB#000049", "PHARM#000015", "PHARM#000016", "RX#000019", "RX#000026", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 44,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:34",
      "text": "I stopped those before, but if they help keep me out of the hospital, I’ll try them again.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 45,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+12:36",
      "text": "We also checked your cortisol level because of your low blood pressure and eosinophils. The first level was in the low‑normal range, and we’re going to do a stimulation test with a medicine called cosyntropin to make sure your adrenal glands are working.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000043", "LAB#000075", "LAB#000096", "LAB#000097", "LAB#000099", "PHARM#000028", "RX#000034", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 46,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:37",
      "text": "Is that like steroids?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 47,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+12:38",
      "text": "It’s a one‑time test dose that acts like the hormone your brain uses to tell your adrenal glands to work. We measure your cortisol before and after to see if they respond properly. It’s not long‑term steroids.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000028", "RX#000034", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 48,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+13:00",
      "text": "Given that your blood pressure is now close to your usual baseline and we haven’t found a clear source of infection, we’re going to stop the broad IV antibiotics and acyclovir. We’ll keep monitoring you and move you out of the ICU to the regular medicine floor later today.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000008", "PHARM#000011", "PHARM#000012", "PHARM#000013", "RX#000008", "RX#000011", "RX#000013", "RX#000020", "ICU#000001", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 49,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+13:01",
      "text": "So you don’t think I have a bad infection causing this?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 50,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+13:03",
      "text": "Right now, with your stable blood pressure, clear chest X‑ray, and no fever, we think your low blood pressure is more related to your usual dialysis‑related drops and possibly the gabapentin side effects, rather than a new severe infection.",
      "evidence_eids": ["RAD#000002", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 51,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+29:15",
      "text": "We’ve transferred you from the MICU to the medicine floor. Your blood pressure is in the 90s over 50s, which is your usual baseline, and your heart rhythm is normal. Let me know if your headache or itching gets worse.",
      "evidence_eids": ["XFER#000004", "XFER#000005", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 52,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+29:16",
      "text": "The itching on my face and body is driving me crazy. The pain is still there too.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 53,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+29:45",
      "text": "On exam, you have those erythematous plaques and small erosions on the right side of your face and forehead, and lots of hyperpigmented, itchy bumps on your arms, legs, chest, and abdomen. Dermatology thinks this is likely eosinophilic folliculitis related to HIV, not active shingles spreading.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000008", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 54,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+29:46",
      "text": "So it’s not new shingles all over?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 55,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+29:47",
      "text": "Correct. We don’t see new blisters like we’d expect with active shingles. It looks more like chronic inflammation of the hair follicles. We’re treating the itching with fexofenadine twice a day and Sarna lotion as needed.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000018", "PHARM#000020", "RX#000023", "RX#000024", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 56,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+29:48",
      "text": "The allergy pill helps a bit, but I still scratch in my sleep.",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 57,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+41:00",
      "text": "This morning’s labs show your hemoglobin is 11.1, white count 2.8, and platelets 119. Your creatinine is 9.8 and BUN 57 before dialysis, potassium is 5.3, and your bicarbonate is 23. These are in the range we expect before your dialysis session.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000055", "LAB#000059", "LAB#000062", "LAB#000063", "LAB#000064", "LAB#000067", "LAB#000071", "LAB#000073"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 58,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+41:01",
      "text": "So I still need my regular dialysis today?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 59,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+41:02",
      "text": "Yes. The renal team has arranged for you to get hemodialysis today on your usual schedule. We’ll continue your sevelamer and cinacalcet as well.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PX#000001", "PHARM#000006", "PHARM#000007", "RX#000002", "RX#000003", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 60,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+43:00",
      "text": "We’re taking you down for dialysis now. Your blood pressure is in the 90s over 50s. During dialysis, your pressure may drop; if it does and you feel dizzy, tell us right away.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PX#000001", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 61,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+43:01",
      "text": "It always drops a bit, but I’ll let you know if I feel bad.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 62,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+45:30",
      "text": "During dialysis your blood pressure dipped into the 60s to 70s systolic, but you didn’t feel dizzy. We gave you a 200 cc normal saline bolus and your pressure came back up.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "PHARM#000021", "RX#000029"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 63,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+45:31",
      "text": "I didn’t really feel it that much. I’m used to my pressure being low after dialysis.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 64,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+47:00",
      "text": "Your post‑dialysis labs tomorrow will likely show your creatinine and potassium coming down. For now, your blood pressure is back in the 80s to 90s systolic, which is your baseline, and you’re not having any symptoms.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000089", "LAB#000093", "LAB#000095", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 65,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+47:01",
      "text": "My head still hurts, though. The pain is like a burning line on my forehead.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 66,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+47:10",
      "text": "We think this is post‑herpetic neuralgia from your prior shingles. We’ve restarted amitriptyline at night, which you said helped you in the past, and you still have oxycodone and acetaminophen as needed.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000007", "PHARM#000030", "PHARM#000029", "PHARM#000004", "RX#000033", "RX#000035", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 67,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+47:11",
      "text": "I remember that pill helping before. I’ll try it again.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 68,
      "speaker": "CONSULT",
      "relative_time": "H+48:00",
      "text": "I’m from Ophthalmology. We examined your right eye. There’s chronic scarring and a sluggish pupil from your prior shingles, but we don’t see any new corneal lesions or acute eye infection. Your blurry vision seems related to the old damage, not something new.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000003", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 69,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+48:01",
      "text": "So nothing new is attacking my eye right now?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 70,
      "speaker": "CONSULT",
      "relative_time": "H+48:02",
      "text": "Correct. We don’t see signs of new shingles in the eye or other acute problems. Continue the pain regimen your primary team has started.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 71,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+60:00",
      "text": "Your cosyntropin stimulation test results are back. Your cortisol levels rose appropriately, so there’s no evidence of adrenal insufficiency. That means your adrenal glands are working fine.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000075", "LAB#000096", "LAB#000097", "LAB#000099", "PHARM#000028", "RX#000034", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 72,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+60:01",
      "text": "So my low blood pressure isn’t from bad adrenal glands?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 73,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+60:02",
      "text": "Right. It’s more likely from your usual dialysis‑related drops and your chronic low baseline, not from adrenal failure.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 74,

{
  "conversation": [
    {
      "turn_id": 1,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:30",
      "text": "Hi, I’m one of the emergency room doctors. I know you just came over from dialysis. Can you tell me in your own words what brought you in today?",

    },
    {
      "turn_id": 2,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:29",
      "text": "My right side of my head has been killing me. It’s that same shingles area around my right eye and forehead. It’s been worse the last few days, and today at dialysis I felt dizzy and lightheaded. My vision’s been blurry too.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 3,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:27",
      "text": "Okay. You’ve had shingles involving that right eye before, with nerve pain there for a long time, right?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000003", "DX#000007", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 4,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:26",
      "text": "Yeah, years now. They told me it was shingles in the eye. I’ve had this burning, stabbing pain on the right forehead and around the eye ever since.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000003", "DX#000007", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 5,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:25",
      "text": "Have you changed any of your pain medicines recently? I see you were on gabapentin before.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 6,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:24",
      "text": "I was taking 100 milligrams of gabapentin, but the pain got worse so I bumped it up myself to 300 once a day over the last few weeks. Then I started feeling really off balance and lightheaded, and my son read the side effects and told me to stop it a day or two ago.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 7,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:22",
      "text": "Got it. Any fevers, chills, neck stiffness, or sensitivity to light or sound?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 8,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:21",
      "text": "No fevers or chills. My neck feels okay. Light and sound don’t really bother me. It’s just this constant pain and itching on my face and scalp and the dizziness.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 9,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:19",
      "text": "You’re on dialysis for kidney failure from HIV, correct? When was your last dialysis and how much fluid did they take off today?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000001", "DX#000002", "DX#000005", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 10,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:18",
      "text": "Yes, I don’t make urine. I go three times a week. I was there today and they took off about 1.2 liters, they said.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 11,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:16",
      "text": "You also have HIV/AIDS and haven’t been on HIV medications for a while, right?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000001", "DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 12,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H-02:15",
      "text": "Yeah, I’ve been off the HIV meds. I had trouble sticking with them and they made me feel sick. I know my CD4 was really low last time.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001", "LAB#000045"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 13,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",

    "one_paragraph_summary": "During this admission, a middle‑aged woman with HIV/AIDS (CD4 6), ESRD on hemodialysis, and prior herpes zoster ophthalmicus with post‑herpetic neuralgia presented from dialysis with worsening right‑sided headache and facial pain, blurry vision, diffuse pruritic rash, dizziness, and hypotension. Initial ED vitals showed systolic BP in the 70s–80s and leukopenia; she received about 3 L of IV fluids, broad‑spectrum antibiotics (vancomycin, cefepime) and acyclovir for possible line or CNS infection or zoster reactivation, and was admitted to the MICU. CT head showed no acute intracranial process but marked falx/tentorium calcifications attributed to ESRD, and chest X‑ray showed clear lungs and a well‑positioned inferior dialysis catheter without acute disease. Labs demonstrated chronic macrocytic anemia, leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, ESRD‑range creatinine and BUN, mild hyperphosphatemia, and very low CD4 count. She had a brief episode of atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response during fluid resuscitation, then reverted to sinus rhythm; troponin was mildly elevated with normal CK/CK‑MB. With stabilization of blood pressure near her low baseline and no clear infectious source, antibiotics and acyclovir were discontinued, and a cosyntropin stimulation test ruled out adrenal insufficiency. Dermatologic findings were consistent with eosinophilic folliculitis and chronic post‑herpetic changes; pruritus was treated with fexofenadine and Sarna lotion, and post‑herpetic neuralgia with amitriptyline plus PRN oxycodone and acetaminophen. Ophthalmology found no new ocular zoster. She continued cinacalcet, sevelamer, and thrice‑weekly hemodialysis, with transient intradialytic hypotension responding to a small saline bolus. HIV prophylaxis with TMP‑SMX three times weekly and azithromycin weekly was restarted. By discharge she was hemodynamically stable at her baseline, ambulatory, with improved pain and pruritus, and was discharged home on her chronic dialysis schedule and updated medications, with outpatient follow‑up arranged.",
